blocks.name: smfpreimage
blocks.content: Given a function measurable w.r.t. to a sigma-algebra, the preimage of a closed interval unbounded above is in the subspace sigma-algebra induced by its domain. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm smfpreimage(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(crab(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), co(c3, crest, c0)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, csalg))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cfv(csmblfn, c3)))
  -| wceq(c0, cdm(c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cr))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  syl2anc(w0, wcel(crab(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), co(c3, crest, c0)), wcel(c1, cr), wral(hs0, cr, wcel(crab(s0, c0, wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), co(c3, crest, c0))))
  simp3d(w0, wral(hs0, cr, wcel(crab(s0, c0, wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), co(c3, crest, c0))), wss(c0, cuni(c3)), wf(c2, c0, cr))
  mpbid(w0, w3a(wss(c0, cuni(c3)), wf(c2, c0, cr), wral(hs0, cr, wcel(crab(s0, c0, wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), co(c3, crest, c0)))), wcel(c2, cfv(csmblfn, c3)))
  issmfge(hs0, s0, c2, c3, c0, w0)
  rspcva(hs0, c1, cr, wcel(crab(s0, c0, wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), co(c3, crest, c0)), wcel(crab(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), co(c3, crest, c0)))
  eleq1d(crab(s0, c0, wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), co(c3, crest, c0), crab(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  rabbidv(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cfv(c2, cv(s0))), wbr(c1, cle, cfv(c2, cv(s0))))
  breq1(cv(hs0), c1, cle, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(crab(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), co(c3, crest, c0)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

thm smfpreimage(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → { s0 ∈ c0 | c1[≤](c2 ` s0)} ∈(c3[|`t]c0))
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ SAlg)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈(SMblFn ` c3))
  ⊣ c0 = dom(c2)
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ ℝ)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
} = {
  syl2anc(w0, { s0 ∈ c0 | c1[≤](c2 ` s0)} ∈(c3[|`t]c0), c1 ∈ ℝ, ∀(hs0 ∈ ℝ, { s0 ∈ c0 | hs0[≤](c2 ` s0)} ∈(c3[|`t]c0)))
  simp3d(w0, ∀(hs0 ∈ ℝ, { s0 ∈ c0 | hs0[≤](c2 ` s0)} ∈(c3[|`t]c0)), c0 ⊆ ⋃ c3, (c2 : c0 → ℝ))
  mpbid(w0, (c0 ⊆ ⋃ c3 ∧(c2 : c0 → ℝ)∧ ∀(hs0 ∈ ℝ, { s0 ∈ c0 | hs0[≤](c2 ` s0)} ∈(c3[|`t]c0))), c2 ∈(SMblFn ` c3))
  issmfge(hs0, s0, c2, c3, c0, w0)
  rspcva(hs0, c1, cr, { s0 ∈ c0 | hs0[≤](c2 ` s0)} ∈(c3[|`t]c0), { s0 ∈ c0 | c1[≤](c2 ` s0)} ∈(c3[|`t]c0))
  eleq1d({ s0 ∈ c0 | hs0[≤](c2 ` s0)}, (c3[|`t]c0), { s0 ∈ c0 | c1[≤](c2 ` s0)}, hs0 = c1)
  rabbidv(s0, c0, hs0 = c1, hs0[≤](c2 ` s0), c1[≤](c2 ` s0))
  breq1(hs0, c1, cle, (c2 ` s0))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)

  nsssmfmbf(c0)

thm smfpimioompt(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {

thm smfresal(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {

  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  issalnnd(hs0, hs1, hs2, c0, universe, cuni(c0), w0)
  a1i(w0, wcel(c0, universe))

  ima0(ccnv(c2))
  0sald(co(c1, crest, c3), w0)
  elrab2(s0, emptycls, c0, cpw(cr), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), emptycls), co(c1, crest, c3)), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), co(c1, crest, c3)))
  eleq1d(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), co(c1, crest, c3), cima(ccnv(c2), emptycls), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls))
  imaeq2(cv(s0), emptycls, ccnv(c2))

  diff.co.s(s0, c1, crest, c3)
  diff.crest.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: smfrec
blocks.content: The reciprocal of a sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. First part of Proposition 121E (e) of [Fremlin1] p. 38 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: smfmullem2
blocks.content: The multiplication of two sigma-measurable functions is measurable: this is the step (i) of the proof of Proposition 121E (d) of [Fremlin1] p. 37 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: smfmullem3
blocks.content: The multiplication of two sigma-measurable functions is measurable: this is the step (i) of the proof of Proposition 121E (d) of [Fremlin1] p. 37 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: smfmullem4
blocks.content: The multiplication of two sigma-measurable functions is measurable. Proposition 121E (d) of [Fremlin1] p. 37 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm smfmullem4(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(crab(s0, cin(c0, c1), wbr(co(c2, cmul, c3), clt, c4)), co(c5, crest, cin(c0, c1))))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, csalg))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c6))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c2, cr))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(c3, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c2), cfv(csmblfn, c5)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c1, c3), cfv(csmblfn, c5)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cr))
  -| wceq(c7, crab(s1, co(cq, cmap, co(nat0, cfz, nat3)), wral(s2, co(cfv(cv(s1), nat0), cioo, cfv(cv(s1), nat1)), wral(s3, co(cfv(cv(s1), nat2), cioo, cfv(cv(s1), nat3)), wbr(co(cv(s2), cmul, cv(s3)), clt, c4)))))
  -| wceq(c8, cmpt(s1, c7, crab(s0, cin(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, co(cfv(cv(s1), nat0), cioo, cfv(cv(s1), nat1))), wcel(c3, co(cfv(cv(s1), nat2), cioo, cfv(cv(s1), nat3)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c7)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c7)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c4)
  -| diffsc(s3, c0)
  -| diffsc(s3, c1)
  -| diffsc(s3, c2)
  -| diffsc(s3, c3)
  -| diffsc(s3, c4)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
  -| diffsw(s3, w0)
} = {
  eqeltrd(crab(s0, cin(c0, c1), wbr(co(c2, cmul, c3), clt, c4)), co(c5, crest, cin(c0, c1)), ciun(s1, c7, cfv(c8, cv(s1))), w0)
  eqssd(crab(s0, cin(c0, c1), wbr(co(c2, cmul, c3), clt, c4)), ciun(s1, c7, cfv(c8, cv(s1))), w0)

blocks.name: smfmul
blocks.content: The multiplication of two sigma-measurable functions is measurable. Proposition 121E (d) of [Fremlin1] p. 37 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: smfmulc1
blocks.content: A sigma-measurable function multiplied by a constant is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121E (c) of [Fremlin1] p. 37 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm smfmulc1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, co(c1, cmul, c2)), cfv(csmblfn, c3)))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, csalg))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c4))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c2, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c2), cfv(csmblfn, c3)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  eqeltrd(cmpt(s0, c0, co(c1, cmul, c2)), cfv(csmblfn, c3), cmpt(s0, cin(c0, c0), co(c1, cmul, c2)), w0)
  a1i(w0, wceq(cmpt(s0, c0, co(c1, cmul, c2)), cmpt(s0, cin(c0, c0), co(c1, cmul, c2))))
  mpteq1i(s0, c0, co(c1, cmul, c2), cin(c0, c0))
  eqcomi(c0, cin(c0, c0))
  inidm(c0)
  smfmul(s0, c0, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, w0)
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(c1, cr))
  smfconst(s0, cmpt(s0, c0, c1), c3, c0, c1, w0)
  eqsstrd(c0, cuni(c3), cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c2)), w0)
  eqcomd(c0, cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c2)), w0)
  dmmptdf(s0, cmpt(s0, c0, c2), c0, c2, cr, w0)
  eqid(cmpt(s0, c0, c2))
  smfdmss(cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c2)), c3, cmpt(s0, c0, c2), w0)
  eqid(cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c2)))
  eqid(cmpt(s0, c0, c1))
  diff.cin.s(s0, c0, c0)
}

thm smfmulc1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦(c1[×]c2))∈(SMblFn ` c3))
  ⊣ F/(s0, w0)
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ SAlg)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ c4)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ c2 ∈ ℝ)
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ ℝ)
  ⊣ (w0 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2)∈(SMblFn ` c3))

  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  eqeltrd((s0 ∈ c0 ↦(c1[×]c2)), (SMblFn ` c3), (s0 ∈(c0 ⋂ c0)↦(c1[×]c2)), w0)
  a1i(w0, (s0 ∈ c0 ↦(c1[×]c2))=(s0 ∈(c0 ⋂ c0)↦(c1[×]c2)))
  mpteq1i(s0, c0, (c1[×]c2), (c0 ⋂ c0))
  eqcomi(c0, (c0 ⋂ c0))
  inidm(c0)
  smfmul(s0, c0, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, w0)
  adantr(w0, s0 ∈ c0, c1 ∈ ℝ)
  smfconst(s0, (s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1), c3, c0, c1, w0)
  eqsstrd(c0, ⋃ c3, dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2)), w0)
  eqcomd(c0, dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2)), w0)
  dmmptdf(s0, (s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2), c0, c2, cr, w0)

  smfdmss(dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2)), c3, (s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2), w0)

}

blocks.name: smfdiv
blocks.content: The fraction of two sigma-measurable functions is measurable. Proposition 121E (e) of [Fremlin1] p. 37 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)

thm smfdiv(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, cin(c0, c1), co(c2, cdiv, c3)), cfv(csmblfn, c4)))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, csalg))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c5))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c2, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c7))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c6)), wcel(c3, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c2), cfv(csmblfn, c4)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c6, c3), cfv(csmblfn, c4)))
  -| wceq(c1, crab(s0, c6, wne(c3, nat0)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
} = {
  eqeltrd(cmpt(s0, cin(c0, c1), co(c2, cdiv, c3)), cfv(csmblfn, c4), cmpt(s0, cin(c0, c1), co(c2, cmul, co(nat1, cdiv, c3))), w0)
  mpteq2da(s0, cin(c0, c1), co(c2, cdiv, c3), co(c2, cmul, co(nat1, cdiv, c3)), w0)
  divrecd(c2, c3, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cin(c0, c1))))
  recnd(c2, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cin(c0, c1))))
  syldan(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cin(c0, c1)), wcel(c2, cr), wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  adantl(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cin(c0, c1)), wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  elinel1(cv(s0), c0, c1)

thm smfdiv(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(s0 ∈(c0 ⋂ c1)↦(c2[÷]c3))∈(SMblFn ` c4))
  ⊣ F/(s0, w0)
  ⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈ SAlg)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ c5)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ c2 ∈ ℝ)
  ⊣ (w0 → c6 ∈ c7)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c6)→ c3 ∈ ℝ)
  ⊣ (w0 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2)∈(SMblFn ` c4))
  ⊣ (w0 →(s0 ∈ c6 ↦ c3)∈(SMblFn ` c4))
  ⊣ c1 = { s0 ∈ c6 | c3 ≠ 0 }
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c6)
} = {
  eqeltrd((s0 ∈(c0 ⋂ c1)↦(c2[÷]c3)), (SMblFn ` c4), (s0 ∈(c0 ⋂ c1)↦(c2[×](1[÷]c3))), w0)
  mpteq2da(s0, (c0 ⋂ c1), (c2[÷]c3), (c2[×](1[÷]c3)), w0)
  divrecd(c2, c3, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈(c0 ⋂ c1)))
  recnd(c2, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈(c0 ⋂ c1)))
  syldan(w0, s0 ∈(c0 ⋂ c1), c2 ∈ ℝ, s0 ∈ c0)
  adantl(w0, s0 ∈(c0 ⋂ c1), s0 ∈ c0)
  elinel1(s0, c0, c1)
  recnd(c3, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈(c0 ⋂ c1)))
  syldan(w0, s0 ∈(c0 ⋂ c1), c3 ∈ ℝ, s0 ∈ c6)
  adantl(w0, s0 ∈(c0 ⋂ c1), s0 ∈ c6)
  sseldi(s0, c6, c1, s0 ∈(c0 ⋂ c1))
  adantl(w0, s0 ∈(c0 ⋂ c1), c3 ≠ 0)
  syl(s0 ∈(c0 ⋂ c1), c3 ≠ 0, s0 ∈ c1)
  elinel2(s0, c0, c1)
  smfmul(s0, c0, c1, c2, (1[÷]c3), c4, c5, w0)
  redivcld(nat1, c3, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c1))
  1red((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c1))
  syldan(w0, s0 ∈ c1, c3 ∈ ℝ, s0 ∈ c6)
  adantl(w0, s0 ∈ c1, s0 ∈ c6)
  sseli(s0, c1, c6)
  eqsstri(c1, c6, { s0 ∈ c6 | c3 ≠ 0 })
  ssrab2(s0, c6, c3 ≠ 0)
  adantl(w0, s0 ∈ c1, c3 ≠ 0)
  syl(s0 ∈ c1, c3 ≠ 0, s0 ∈ { s0 ∈ c6 | c3 ≠ 0 })
  biimpi(s0 ∈ c1, s0 ∈ { s0 ∈ c6 | c3 ≠ 0 })
  eleq2i(s0, c1, { s0 ∈ c6 | c3 ≠ 0 })
  rabidim2(s0, c6, c3 ≠ 0)
  smfrec(s0, c1, c3, c4, c6, c7, w0)
}

blocks.name: smfpimbor1lem2
blocks.content: Given a sigma-measurable function, the preimage of a Borel set belongs to the subspace sigma-algebra induced by the domain of the function. Proposition 121E (f) of [Fremlin1] p. 37 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)

thm smfpimbor1lem2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, crest, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, csalg))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c5))

  -| wceq(c7, crab(s0, cpw(cr), wcel(cima(ccnv(c3), cv(s0)), co(c1, crest, c2))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)

} = {

  a1i(w0, wcel(c4, ctop))
  eqeltri(c4, ctop, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
  retop()
  smfresal(s0, c7, c1, c3, c2, w0)
  eqtr4d(cuni(c7), cuni(c4), cr, w0)
  eqssd(cuni(c7), cr, w0)
  a1i(w0, wss(cuni(c7), cr))

  eluni2f(s0, cv(hs0), c7)
  rexlimd(s0, c7, wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(c7)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cr))
  nfel(s0, cv(hs0), cuni(c7))
  nfcv(s0, cv(hs0))
  nfuni(s0, c7)
  nfcxfr(s0, c7, crab(s0, cpw(cr), wcel(cima(ccnv(c3), cv(s0)), co(c1, crest, c2))))
  nfrab1(s0, cpw(cr), wcel(cima(ccnv(c3), cv(s0)), co(c1, crest, c2)))
  nfv(s0, wcel(cv(hs0), cr))
  a1i(wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(c7)), wi(wcel(cv(s0), c7), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cr))))
  ex(wcel(cv(s0), c7), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cr))
  sseldd(cv(hs0), cr, cv(s0), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c7), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))
  adantr(wcel(cv(s0), c7), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), cr))
  syl(wcel(cv(s0), c7), wss(cv(s0), cr), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(cr)))
  syl(wcel(cv(s0), c7), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(cr)), wcel(cv(s0), crab(s0, cpw(cr), wcel(cima(ccnv(c3), cv(s0)), co(c1, crest, c2)))))
  biimpi(wcel(cv(s0), c7), wcel(cv(s0), crab(s0, cpw(cr), wcel(cima(ccnv(c3), cv(s0)), co(c1, crest, c2)))))
  eleq2i(cv(s0), c7, crab(s0, cpw(cr), wcel(cima(ccnv(c3), cv(s0)), co(c1, crest, c2))))

  eleq1d(cima(ccnv(c3), cv(s0)), co(c1, crest, c2), cima(ccnv(c3), c6), wceq(cv(s0), c6))
  imaeq2(cv(s0), c6, ccnv(c3))
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.wa.s(s0, w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), c4)
  diffcc.ex(cv(hs0), c7)
  diff.cv.c(c7, hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c7)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), cr)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(cuni(c7))
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, cr)

  diff.co.s(s0, c1, crest, c2)

thm smfpimbor1lem2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈(c1[|`t]c2))
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ SAlg)
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈(SMblFn ` c1))
  ⊣ c2 = dom(c3)
  ⊣ c4 =(topGen ` ran((,)))
  ⊣ c5 =(SalGen ` c4)
  ⊣ (w0 → c6 ∈ c5)
  ⊣ c0 =(`' c3 " c6)
  ⊣ c7 = { s0 ∈ P(ℝ)|(`' c3 " s0)∈(c1[|`t]c2)}
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, c4)
  ⊣ d(s0, c6)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  syl5eqel(c0, (c1[|`t]c2), (`' c3 " c6), w0)
  simprd(w0, (`' c3 " c6)∈(c1[|`t]c2), c6 ∈ P(ℝ))
  sylib(w0, (c6 ∈ P(ℝ)∧(`' c3 " c6)∈(c1[|`t]c2)), c6 ∈ c7)
  sseldd(c6, c7, c5, w0)
  salgenss(c5, c7, c4, ctop, w0)
  a1i(w0, c4 ∈ Top)
  eqeltri(c4, ctop, (topGen ` ran((,))))
  retop()
  smfresal(s0, c7, c1, c3, c2, w0)
  eqtr4d(⋃ c7, ⋃ c4, cr, w0)
  eqssd(⋃ c7, cr, w0)
  a1i(w0, ⋃ c7 ⊆ ℝ)
  mpbir(⋃ c7 ⊆ ℝ, ∀(hs0 ∈ ⋃ c7, hs0 ∈ ℝ))
  rgen(hs0, ⋃ c7, hs0 ∈ ℝ)
  mpd(hs0 ∈ ⋃ c7, hs0 ∈ ℝ, ∃(s0 ∈ c7, hs0 ∈ s0))
  biimpi(hs0 ∈ ⋃ c7, ∃(s0 ∈ c7, hs0 ∈ s0))
  eluni2f(s0, hs0, c7)
  rexlimd(s0, c7, hs0 ∈ ⋃ c7, hs0 ∈ s0, hs0 ∈ ℝ)
  nfel(s0, hs0, ⋃ c7)
  nfcv(s0, hs0)
  nfuni(s0, c7)
  nfcxfr(s0, c7, { s0 ∈ P(ℝ)|(`' c3 " s0)∈(c1[|`t]c2)})
  nfrab1(s0, P(ℝ), (`' c3 " s0)∈(c1[|`t]c2))
  nfv(s0, hs0 ∈ ℝ)
  a1i(hs0 ∈ ⋃ c7, (s0 ∈ c7 →(hs0 ∈ s0 → hs0 ∈ ℝ)))
  ex(s0 ∈ c7, hs0 ∈ s0, hs0 ∈ ℝ)
  sseldd(hs0, cr, s0, (s0 ∈ c7 ∧ hs0 ∈ s0))
  adantr(s0 ∈ c7, hs0 ∈ s0, s0 ⊆ ℝ)
  syl(s0 ∈ c7, s0 ⊆ ℝ, s0 ∈ P(ℝ))
  syl(s0 ∈ c7, s0 ∈ P(ℝ), s0 ∈ { s0 ∈ P(ℝ)|(`' c3 " s0)∈(c1[|`t]c2)})
  biimpi(s0 ∈ c7, s0 ∈ { s0 ∈ P(ℝ)|(`' c3 " s0)∈(c1[|`t]c2)})
  eleq2i(s0, c7, { s0 ∈ P(ℝ)|(`' c3 " s0)∈(c1[|`t]c2)})
  rabidim1(s0, P(ℝ), (`' c3 " s0)∈(c1[|`t]c2))
  elpwi(s0, cr)
  simpr(s0 ∈ c7, hs0 ∈ s0)
  dfss3(hs0, ⋃ c7, cr)
  eqsstrd(cr, ⋃ c7, ⋃ c4, w0)
  eqcomd(cr, ⋃ c4, w0)
  unissd(c4, c7, w0)
  ssd(hs0, c4, c7, w0)
  smfpimbor1lem1(s0, hs0, c7, c1, c3, c2, c4, (w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c4))
  adantr(w0, hs0 ∈ c4, c1 ∈ SAlg)
  adantr(w0, hs0 ∈ c4, c3 ∈(SMblFn ` c1))
  simpr(w0, hs0 ∈ c4)
  a1i(w0, ⋃ c4 = ℝ)
  eqtr2i(⋃ c4, cr, ⋃(topGen ` ran((,))))
  uniretop()
  unieqi((topGen ` ran((,))), c4)
  eqcomi((topGen ` ran((,))), c4)
  elrab2(s0, c6, c7, P(ℝ), (`' c3 " c6)∈(c1[|`t]c2), (`' c3 " s0)∈(c1[|`t]c2))
  eleq1d((`' c3 " s0), (c1[|`t]c2), (`' c3 " c6), s0 = c6)
  imaeq2(s0, c6, `' c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)

  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)

thm smfpimbor1(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {

blocks.name: smf2id
blocks.content: Twice the identity function is Borel sigma-measurable (just an example, to test previous general theorems). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)

thm smf2id(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0))), cfv(csmblfn, c1)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))

  -| wi(w0, wss(c0, cr))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  smfmulc1(s0, c0, nat2, cv(s0), c1, universe, w0)
  nfv(s0, w0)
  salgencld(c1, c2, ctop, w0)
  a1i(w0, wcel(c2, ctop))
  eqeltri(c2, ctop, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
  retop()
  ssexd(c0, cr, universe, w0)
  a1i(w0, wcel(cr, universe))
  reex()
  sseldd(cv(s0), cr, c0, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wss(c0, cr))
  simpr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  a1i(w0, wcel(nat2, cr))
  2re()
  smfid(s0, c0, c1, c2, w0)
  diff.nat2.s(s0)
}

thm smf2id(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦(2[×]s0))∈(SMblFn ` c1))
  ⊣ c2 =(topGen ` ran((,)))
  ⊣ c1 =(SalGen ` c2)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ⊆ ℝ)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  smfmulc1(s0, c0, nat2, s0, c1, universe, w0)
  nfv(s0, w0)
  salgencld(c1, c2, ctop, w0)
  a1i(w0, c2 ∈ Top)
  eqeltri(c2, ctop, (topGen ` ran((,))))
  retop()
  ssexd(c0, cr, universe, w0)
  a1i(w0, ℝ ∈ 𝕌)
  reex()
  sseldd(s0, cr, c0, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0))
  adantr(w0, s0 ∈ c0, c0 ⊆ ℝ)
  simpr(w0, s0 ∈ c0)
  a1i(w0, 2 ∈ ℝ)
  2re()
  smfid(s0, c0, c1, c2, w0)
  diff.nat2.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: smfco
blocks.content: The composition of a Borel sigma-measurable function with a sigma-measurable function, is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121E (g) of [Fremlin1] p. 37 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)

  imaeq2(cima(ccnv(c0), co(cmnf, cioo, cv(hs1))), cin(cv(hs2), cdm(c0)), ccnv(c1))

thm smfco(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(c0 ∘ c1)∈(SMblFn ` c2))
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ SAlg)
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈(SMblFn ` c2))
  ⊣ c3 =(topGen ` ran((,)))
  ⊣ c4 =(SalGen ` c3)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈(SMblFn ` c4))
} = {
  issmfd(hs1, hs0, (c0 ∘ c1), c2, (`' c1 " dom(c0)), w0)
  nfv(hs1, w0)
  sstrd((`' c1 " dom(c0)), ⋃ c2, dom(c1), w0)
  smfdmss(dom(c1), c2, c1, w0)
  eqeltrd({ hs0 ∈(`' c1 " dom(c0))|((c0 ∘ c1)` hs0)[<]hs1 }, (c2[|`t](`' c1 " dom(c0))), (`' c1 "(`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1))), (w0 ∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ))
  3eqtrd({ hs0 ∈(`' c1 " dom(c0))|((c0 ∘ c1)` hs0)[<]hs1 }, (`' c1 "(`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1))), (`'(c0 ∘ c1)"(-∞[(,)]hs1)), ((`' c1 ∘ `' c0)"(-∞[(,)]hs1)), (w0 ∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ))
  eqcomd({ hs0 ∈(`' c1 " dom(c0))|((c0 ∘ c1)` hs0)[<]hs1 }, (`'(c0 ∘ c1)"(-∞[(,)]hs1)), (w0 ∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ))

  fco3(c0, c1, w0)

  a1i((w0 ∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ), (`'(c0 ∘ c1)"(-∞[(,)]hs1))=((`' c1 ∘ `' c0)"(-∞[(,)]hs1)))
  imaeq1i(`'(c0 ∘ c1), (-∞[(,)]hs1), (`' c1 ∘ `' c0))
  cnvco(c0, c1)
  a1i((w0 ∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ), ((`' c1 ∘ `' c0)"(-∞[(,)]hs1))=(`' c1 "(`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1))))
  imaco(`' c1, `' c0, (-∞[(,)]hs1))
  mpd((w0 ∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ), (`' c1 "(`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1)))∈(c2[|`t](`' c1 " dom(c0))), ∃(hs2 ∈ c4,(`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1))=(hs2 ⋂ dom(c0))))
  mpbid((w0 ∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ), ∃(hs2 ∈ c4,(`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1))=(hs2 ⋂ dom(c0))), (`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1))∈(c4[|`t]dom(c0)))
  eqeltrd((`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1)), (c4[|`t]dom(c0)), { hs0 ∈ dom(c0)|(c0 ` hs0)[<]hs1 }, (w0 ∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ))
  eqcomd((`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1)), { hs0 ∈ dom(c0)|(c0 ` hs0)[<]hs1 }, (w0 ∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ))
  eqcomd({ hs0 ∈ dom(c0)|(c0 ` hs0)[<]hs1 }, (`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1)), (w0 ∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ))
  preimaioomnf(hs0, c0, hs1, dom(c0), (w0 ∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ))
  adantr(w0, hs1 ∈ ℝ, (c0 : dom(c0)→ ℝ))
  smff(c0, dom(c0), c4, w0)
  adantl(w0, hs1 ∈ ℝ, hs1 ∈ ℝ*)
  rexr(hs1)
  smfpreimalt(hs0, dom(c0), c0, hs1, c4, (w0 ∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ))
  adantr(w0, hs1 ∈ ℝ, c4 ∈ SAlg)
  adantr(w0, hs1 ∈ ℝ, c0 ∈(SMblFn ` c4))
  eqid(dom(c0))
  simpr(w0, hs1 ∈ ℝ)
  adantr(w0, hs1 ∈ ℝ, ((`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1))∈(c4[|`t]dom(c0))↔ ∃(hs2 ∈ c4,(`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1))=(hs2 ⋂ dom(c0)))))
  syl2anc(w0, ((`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1))∈(c4[|`t]dom(c0))↔ ∃(hs2 ∈ c4,(`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1))=(hs2 ⋂ dom(c0)))), c4 ∈ 𝕌, dom(c0)∈ 𝕌)

  3exp(w0, hs2 ∈ c4, (`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1))=(hs2 ⋂ dom(c0)), (`' c1 "(`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1)))∈(c2[|`t](`' c1 " dom(c0))))
  eqeltrd((`' c1 "(`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1))), (c2[|`t](`' c1 " dom(c0))), (`' c1 "(hs2 ⋂ dom(c0))), (w0 ∧ hs2 ∈ c4 ∧(`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1))=(hs2 ⋂ dom(c0))))
  3ad2ant3(w0, hs2 ∈ c4, (`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1))=(hs2 ⋂ dom(c0)), (`' c1 "(`' c0 "(-∞[(,)]hs1)))=(`' c1 "(hs2 ⋂ dom(c0))))

blocks.name: smfneg
blocks.content: The negative of a sigma-measurable function is measurable. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm smfneg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, cneg(c1)), cfv(csmblfn, c2)))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, csalg))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c3))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cfv(csmblfn, c2)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  eqeltrd(cmpt(s0, c0, cneg(c1)), cfv(csmblfn, c2), cmpt(s0, c0, co(cneg(nat1), cmul, c1)), w0)
  mpteq2da(s0, c0, cneg(c1), co(cneg(nat1), cmul, c1), w0)
  eqcomd(cneg(c1), co(cneg(nat1), cmul, c1), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  mulm1d(c1, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  recnd(c1, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  smfmulc1(s0, c0, cneg(nat1), c1, c2, c3, w0)
  a1i(w0, wcel(cneg(nat1), cr))
  neg1rr()
  diff.cneg.s(s0, nat1)
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm smfneg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ -u(c1))∈(SMblFn ` c2))
  ⊣ F/(s0, w0)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ SAlg)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ c3)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ c1 ∈ ℝ)
  ⊣ (w0 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)∈(SMblFn ` c2))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  eqeltrd((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ -u(c1)), (SMblFn ` c2), (s0 ∈ c0 ↦(-u(1)[×]c1)), w0)
  mpteq2da(s0, c0, -u(c1), (-u(1)[×]c1), w0)
  eqcomd(-u(c1), (-u(1)[×]c1), (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0))
  mulm1d(c1, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0))
  recnd(c1, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0))
  smfmulc1(s0, c0, -u(1), c1, c2, c3, w0)
  a1i(w0, -u(1)∈ ℝ)
  neg1rr()
  diff.cneg.s(s0, nat1)
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: smffmpt
blocks.content: A function measurable w.r.t. to a sigma-algebra, is actually a function. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm smffmpt(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wf(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), c0, cr))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, csalg))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cfv(csmblfn, c2)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, wf(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), c0, cr), wf(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), cr))
  smff(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), c2, w0)
  eqid(cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)))
  feq2d(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), c0, cr, cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), w0)
  eqcomd(c0, cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), w0)
  dmmptdf(s0, cmpt(s0, c0, c1), c0, c1, c3, w0)
  eqid(cmpt(s0, c0, c1))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm smffmpt(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1): c0 → ℝ))
  ⊣ F/(s0, w0)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ SAlg)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ c1 ∈ c3)
  ⊣ (w0 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)∈(SMblFn ` c2))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, ((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1): c0 → ℝ), ((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1): dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1))→ ℝ))
  smff((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1), dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)), c2, w0)
  eqid(dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)))
  feq2d((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1), c0, cr, dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)), w0)
  eqcomd(c0, dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)), w0)
  dmmptdf(s0, (s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1), c0, c1, c3, w0)
  eqid((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1))
}

blocks.name: smflim2
blocks.content: The limit of a sequence of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (a) of [Fremlin1] p. 38 . Notice that every function in the sequence can have a different (partial) domain, and the domain of convergence can be decidedly irregular (Remark 121G of [Fremlin1] p. 39 ). TODO: this has fewer distinct variable conditions than ~ smflim and should replace it. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: smfpimcc
blocks.content: Given a countable set of sigma-measurable functions, and a Borel set ` A ` there exists a choice function ` h ` that, for each measurable function, chooses a measurable set that, when intersected with the function's domain, gives the preimage of ` A ` . This is a generalization of the observation at the beginning of the proof of Proposition 121F of [Fremlin1] p. 39 . The statement would also be provable for uncountable sets, but in most cases it will suffice to consider the countable case, and only the axiom of countable choice will be needed. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: issmfle2d
blocks.content: A sufficient condition for " ` F ` being a measurable function w.r.t. to the sigma-algebra ` S ` ". (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm issmfle2d(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(csmblfn, c1)))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, csalg))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c2, cuni(c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c2, cr))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cr)), wcel(cima(ccnv(c0), co(cmnf, cioc, cv(s0))), co(c1, crest, c2)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  issmfled(s0, hs0, c0, c1, c2, w0)
  eqeltrrd(crab(hs0, c2, wbr(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cle, cv(s0))), co(c1, crest, c2), cima(ccnv(c0), co(cmnf, cioc, cv(s0))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cr)))
  preimaiocmnf(hs0, c0, cv(s0), c2, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cr)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cr), wf(c0, c2, cr))
  adantl(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cr), wcel(cv(s0), cxr))
  rexr(cv(s0))
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s0))
  diff.hs0.w(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cr)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm issmfle2d(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈(SMblFn ` c1))
  ⊣ F/(s0, w0)
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ SAlg)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ⊆ ⋃ c1)
  ⊣ (w0 →(c0 : c2 → ℝ))
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ ℝ)→(`' c0 "(-∞[(,]]s0))∈(c1[|`t]c2))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  issmfled(s0, hs0, c0, c1, c2, w0)
  eqeltrrd({ hs0 ∈ c2 |(c0 ` hs0)[≤]s0 }, (c1[|`t]c2), (`' c0 "(-∞[(,]]s0)), (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ ℝ))
  preimaiocmnf(hs0, c0, s0, c2, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ ℝ))
  adantr(w0, s0 ∈ ℝ, (c0 : c2 → ℝ))
  adantl(w0, s0 ∈ ℝ, s0 ∈ ℝ*)
  rexr(s0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(s0)
  diff.hs0.w((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ ℝ))
}

blocks.name: smflimmpt
blocks.content: The limit of a sequence of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (a) of [Fremlin1] p. 38 . Notice that every function in the sequence can have a different (partial) domain, and the domain of convergence can be decidedly irregular (Remark 121G of [Fremlin1] p. 39 ). ` A ` can contain ` m ` as a free variable, in other words it can be thought as an indexed collection ` A ( m ) ` . ` B ` can be thought as a collection with two indices ` B ( m , x ) ` . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: smfsuplem1
blocks.content: The supremum of a countable set of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (b) of [Fremlin1] p. 38 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: smfsuplem2
blocks.content: The supremum of a countable set of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (b) of [Fremlin1] p. 38 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:

  smfsuplem2(s0, s1, s2, c0, cv(hs0), c1, c5, c2, c3, c4, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cr)))

  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cr), wf(c4, c3, cfv(csmblfn, c1)))

thm smfsuplem3(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈(SMblFn ` c1))
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ ℤ)
  ⊣ c3 =(ℤ≥ ` c2)
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ SAlg)
  ⊣ (w0 →(c4 : c3 →(SMblFn ` c1)))
  ⊣ c5 = { s0 ∈ ⋂(s1 ∈ c3, dom((c4 ` s1)))| ∃(s2 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s1 ∈ c3,((c4 ` s1)` s0)[≤]s2))}
  ⊣ c0 =(s0 ∈ c5 ↦ sup(ran((s1 ∈ c3 ↦((c4 ` s1)` s0))), ℝ, <))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, c4)
  ⊣ d(s0, c5)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c4)
  ⊣ d(s1, c5)
  ⊣ d(s2, c1)
  ⊣ d(s2, c3)
  ⊣ d(s2, c4)
  ⊣ d(s2, c5)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
  ⊣ d(s2, w0)
} = {
  issmfle2d(hs0, c0, c1, c5, w0)
  nfv(hs0, w0)
  sstrd(c5, ⋃ c1, ⋂(s1 ∈ c3, dom((c4 ` s1))), w0)
  a1i(w0, c5 ⊆ ⋂(s1 ∈ c3, dom((c4 ` s1))))
  iinssd(s1, c3, dom((c4 ` s1)), ⋃ c1, c2, dom((c4 ` c2)), w0)
  dmeqd((c4 ` s1), (c4 ` c2), s1 = c2)
  fveq2(s1, c2, c4)
  smfdmss(dom((c4 ` c2)), c1, (c4 ` c2), w0)
  ffvelrnd(c4, c2, (SMblFn ` c1), c3, w0)
  eqid(dom((c4 ` c2)))
  fmptd(s0, c0, c5, cr, sup(ran((s1 ∈ c3 ↦((c4 ` s1)` s0))), ℝ, <), w0)
  suprclrnmpt(s1, s2, c3, ((c4 ` s1)` s0), (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c5))
  nfv(s1, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c5))
  adantr(w0, s0 ∈ c5, c3 ≠ ∅)
  ne0d(c3, c2, w0)
  syl6eleqr(c2, c3, (ℤ≥ ` c2), w0)
  syl(w0, c2 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c2), c2 ∈ ℤ)
  uzid(c2)
  ffvelrnd((c4 ` s1), s0, cr, dom((c4 ` s1)), ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c5)∧ s1 ∈ c3))
  adantlr(w0, s0 ∈ c5, s1 ∈ c3, ((c4 ` s1): dom((c4 ` s1))→ ℝ))
  smff((c4 ` s1), dom((c4 ` s1)), c1, (w0 ∧ s1 ∈ c3))
  adantr(w0, s1 ∈ c3, c1 ∈ SAlg)
  ffvelrnda(s1, c3, c4, (SMblFn ` c1), w0)
  eqid(dom((c4 ` s1)))
  adantll(w0, s0 ∈ c5, s1 ∈ c3, s0 ∈ dom((c4 ` s1)))
  sseldd(s0, dom((c4 ` s1)), ⋂(s1 ∈ c3, dom((c4 ` s1))), (s0 ∈ c5 ∧ s1 ∈ c3))
  adantl(s0 ∈ c5, s1 ∈ c3, ⋂(s1 ∈ c3, dom((c4 ` s1)))⊆ dom((c4 ` s1)))
  iinss2(s1, c3, dom((c4 ` s1)))
  adantr(s0 ∈ c5, s1 ∈ c3, s0 ∈ ⋂(s1 ∈ c3, dom((c4 ` s1))))
  sseli(s0, c5, ⋂(s1 ∈ c3, dom((c4 ` s1))))
  eqsstri(c5, ⋂(s1 ∈ c3, dom((c4 ` s1))), { s0 ∈ ⋂(s1 ∈ c3, dom((c4 ` s1)))| ∃(s2 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s1 ∈ c3,((c4 ` s1)` s0)[≤]s2))})
  ssrab2(s0, ⋂(s1 ∈ c3, dom((c4 ` s1))), ∃(s2 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s1 ∈ c3,((c4 ` s1)` s0)[≤]s2)))
  adantl(w0, s0 ∈ c5, ∃(s2 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s1 ∈ c3,((c4 ` s1)` s0)[≤]s2)))
  simprbi(s0 ∈ c5, ∃(s2 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s1 ∈ c3,((c4 ` s1)` s0)[≤]s2)), s0 ∈ ⋂(s1 ∈ c3, dom((c4 ` s1))))
  rabeq2i(s0, c5, ⋂(s1 ∈ c3, dom((c4 ` s1))), ∃(s2 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s1 ∈ c3,((c4 ` s1)` s0)[≤]s2)))
  smfsuplem2(s0, s1, s2, c0, hs0, c1, c5, c2, c3, c4, (w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ ℝ))
  adantr(w0, hs0 ∈ ℝ, c2 ∈ ℤ)
  adantr(w0, hs0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ SAlg)
  adantr(w0, hs0 ∈ ℝ, (c4 : c3 →(SMblFn ` c1)))
  simpr(w0, hs0 ∈ ℝ)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.ciin.s(s0, s1, c3, dom((c4 ` s1)))
  diff.cdm.s(s0, (c4 ` s1))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c4, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cuni.s(s1, c1)
  diff.cdm.s(s1, (c4 ` c2))
  diff.cfv.s(s1, c4, c2)
  diff.cr.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s2, (c4 ` s1), s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s2, c4, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s1)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
  diff.wa.s(s1, w0, s0 ∈ c5)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, s0, c5)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.wa.s(s2, w0, hs0 ∈ ℝ)
  diff.wcel.s(s2, hs0, cr)
  diff.cv.s(s2, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s2, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)

blocks.name: smfsup
blocks.content: The supremum of a countable set of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (b) of [Fremlin1] p. 38 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm smfsup(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(csmblfn, c1)))
  -| wnfc(s0, c2)
  -| wnfc(s1, c2)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cz))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cuz, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, csalg))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c2, c4, cfv(csmblfn, c1)))
  -| wceq(c5, crab(s1, ciin(s0, c4, cdm(cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), wrex(s2, cr, wral(s0, c4, wbr(cfv(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), cle, cv(s2))))))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s1, c5, csup(crn(cmpt(s0, c4, cfv(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cv(s1)))), cr, clt)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c4)
} = {
  smfsuplem3(hs0, hs2, hs1, c0, c1, c3, c4, c2, c5, w0)
  eqtri(c5, crab(hs0, ciin(hs2, c4, cdm(cfv(c2, cv(hs2)))), wrex(hs1, cr, wral(hs2, c4, wbr(cfv(cfv(c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs0)), cle, cv(hs1))))), crab(s1, ciin(s0, c4, cdm(cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), wrex(s2, cr, wral(s0, c4, wbr(cfv(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), cle, cv(s2))))))
  cbvrabcsf(s1, hs0, ciin(s0, c4, cdm(cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), ciin(hs2, c4, cdm(cfv(c2, cv(hs2)))), wrex(s2, cr, wral(s0, c4, wbr(cfv(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), cle, cv(s2)))), wrex(hs1, cr, wral(hs2, c4, wbr(cfv(cfv(c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs0)), cle, cv(hs1)))))
  nfcv(hs0, ciin(s0, c4, cdm(cfv(c2, cv(s0)))))
  nfiin(s1, hs2, c4, cdm(cfv(c2, cv(hs2))))
  nfdm(s1, cfv(c2, cv(hs2)))
  nfv(hs0, wrex(s2, cr, wral(s0, c4, wbr(cfv(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), cle, cv(s2)))))
  nfrex(s1, hs1, cr, wral(hs2, c4, wbr(cfv(cfv(c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs0)), cle, cv(hs1))))
  nfral(s1, hs2, c4, wbr(cfv(cfv(c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs0)), cle, cv(hs1)))
  nfbr(s1, cfv(cfv(c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs0)), cle, cv(hs1))
  nfcv(s1, cle)
  nfcv(s1, cv(hs1))
  a1i(wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wceq(ciin(s0, c4, cdm(cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), ciin(hs2, c4, cdm(cfv(c2, cv(hs2))))))
  cbviin(s0, hs2, c4, cdm(cfv(c2, cv(s0))), cdm(cfv(c2, cv(hs2))))
  nfcv(hs2, cdm(cfv(c2, cv(s0))))

blocks.name: smfsupmpt
blocks.content: The supremum of a countable set of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (b) of [Fremlin1] p. 38 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

thm smfsupmpt(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(csmblfn, c1)))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wnf(s1, w0)
  -| wnf(s2, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))

blocks.name: smfsupxr
blocks.content: The supremum of a countable set of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (b) of [Fremlin1] p. 38 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm smfsupxr(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(csmblfn, c1)))
  -| wnfc(s0, c2)
  -| wnfc(s1, c2)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cz))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cuz, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, csalg))

blocks.name: smfinflem
blocks.content: The infimum of a countable set of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (c) of [Fremlin1] p. 38 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: smfinf
blocks.content: The infimum of a countable set of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (c) of [Fremlin1] p. 38 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm smfinf(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(csmblfn, c1)))
  -| wnfc(s0, c2)
  -| wnfc(s1, c2)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cz))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cuz, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, csalg))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c2, c4, cfv(csmblfn, c1)))
  -| wceq(c5, crab(s1, ciin(s0, c4, cdm(cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), wrex(s2, cr, wral(s0, c4, wbr(cv(s2), cle, cfv(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cv(s1)))))))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s1, c5, cinf(crn(cmpt(s0, c4, cfv(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cv(s1)))), cr, clt)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c4)
} = {
  smfinflem(hs0, hs2, hs1, c0, c1, c3, c4, c2, c5, w0)
  eqtri(c5, crab(hs0, ciin(hs2, c4, cdm(cfv(c2, cv(hs2)))), wrex(hs1, cr, wral(hs2, c4, wbr(cv(hs1), cle, cfv(cfv(c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs0)))))), crab(s1, ciin(s0, c4, cdm(cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), wrex(s2, cr, wral(s0, c4, wbr(cv(s2), cle, cfv(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cv(s1)))))))
  cbvrabcsf(s1, hs0, ciin(s0, c4, cdm(cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), ciin(hs2, c4, cdm(cfv(c2, cv(hs2)))), wrex(s2, cr, wral(s0, c4, wbr(cv(s2), cle, cfv(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cv(s1))))), wrex(hs1, cr, wral(hs2, c4, wbr(cv(hs1), cle, cfv(cfv(c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs0))))))

  nfrex(s1, hs1, cr, wral(hs2, c4, wbr(cv(hs1), cle, cfv(cfv(c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs0)))))
  nfral(s1, hs2, c4, wbr(cv(hs1), cle, cfv(cfv(c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs0))))
  nfbr(s1, cv(hs1), cle, cfv(cfv(c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs0)))

blocks.name: smfinfmpt
blocks.content: The infimum of a countable set of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (c) of [Fremlin1] p. 38 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

thm smfinfmpt(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(csmblfn, c1)))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wnf(s1, w0)
  -| wnf(s2, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cuz, c2))

blocks.name: smflimsuplem1
blocks.content: If ` H ` converges, the ` limsup ` of ` F ` is real. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm smflimsuplem1(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wss(cdm(cfv(c0, c1)), cdm(cfv(c2, c1))))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cuz, c4))
  -| wceq(c5, cmpt(s0, c3, crab(s1, ciin(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), cdm(cfv(c2, cv(s2)))), wcel(csup(crn(cmpt(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), cfv(cfv(c2, cv(s2)), cv(s1)))), cxr, clt), cr))))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, c3, cmpt(s1, cfv(c5, cv(s0)), csup(crn(cmpt(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), cfv(cfv(c2, cv(s2)), cv(s1)))), cxr, clt))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c3))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)

  ⊣ c0 =(s0 ∈ c3 ↦(s1 ∈(c5 ` s0)↦ sup(ran((s2 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0)↦((c2 ` s2)` s1))), ℝ*, <)))
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, c5)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c5)
  ⊣ d(s2, c2)
} = {
  eqsstrd(dom((c0 ` c1)), dom((c2 ` c1)), { s1 ∈ ⋂(hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), dom((c2 ` hs0)))| sup(ran((hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)↦((c2 ` hs0)` s1))), ℝ*, <)∈ ℝ }, w0)
  3eqtrd(dom((c0 ` c1)), { s1 ∈ ⋂(hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), dom((c2 ` hs0)))| sup(ran((hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)↦((c2 ` hs0)` s1))), ℝ*, <)∈ ℝ }, dom((s1 ∈(c5 ` c1)↦ sup(ran((hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)↦((c2 ` hs0)` s1))), ℝ*, <))), (c5 ` c1), w0)
  dmeqd((c0 ` c1), (s1 ∈(c5 ` c1)↦ sup(ran((hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)↦((c2 ` hs0)` s1))), ℝ*, <)), w0)
  fvmptd3(s0, c0, c1, (s1 ∈(c5 ` c1)↦ sup(ran((hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)↦((c2 ` hs0)` s1))), ℝ*, <)), c3, (s1 ∈(c5 ` s0)↦ sup(ran((s2 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0)↦((c2 ` s2)` s1))), ℝ*, <)), universe, w0)

  a1i(s0 = c1, (s1 ∈(c5 ` s0)↦ sup(ran((s2 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0)↦((c2 ` s2)` s1))), ℝ*, <))=(s1 ∈(c5 ` s0)↦ sup(ran((hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0)↦((c2 ` hs0)` s1))), ℝ*, <)))

blocks.name: smflimsuplem2
blocks.content: The superior limit of a sequence of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (d) of [Fremlin1] p. 39 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: smflimsuplem4
blocks.content: If ` H ` converges, the ` limsup ` of ` F ` is real. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

thm smflimsuplem6(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦((c1 ` s0)` c2))∈ dom(~~>))
  ⊣ F/(s0, w0)
  ⊣ F/(s1, w0)
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ ℤ)
  ⊣ c0 =(ℤ≥ ` c3)
  ⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈ SAlg)
  ⊣ (w0 →(c5 : c0 →(SMblFn ` c4)))
  ⊣ c6 =(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ { s2 ∈ ⋂(s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0), dom((c5 ` s1)))| sup(ran((s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0)↦((c5 ` s1)` s2))), ℝ*, <)∈ ℝ })
  ⊣ c1 =(s0 ∈ c0 ↦(s2 ∈(c6 ` s0)↦ sup(ran((s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0)↦((c5 ` s1)` s2))), ℝ*, <)))
  ⊣ (w0 →(limsup `(s1 ∈ c0 ↦((c5 ` s1)` c2)))∈ ℝ)
  ⊣ (w0 → c7 ∈ c0)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ ⋂(s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c7), dom((c5 ` s1))))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c5)
  ⊣ d(s0, c7)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c7)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c5)
} = {
  syl3anc(w0, (s0 ∈ c0 ↦((c1 ` s0)` c2))∈ dom(~~>), (s0 ∈ c0 ↦((c1 ` s0)` c2))∈ 𝕌, (limsup `(s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c7)↦((c5 ` s1)` c2)))∈ 𝕌, (s0 ∈ c0 ↦((c1 ` s0)` c2))[~~>](limsup `(s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c7)↦((c5 ` s1)` c2))))

  fvexd(clsp, (s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c7)↦((c5 ` s1)` c2)), w0)
  mpbird(w0, (s0 ∈ c0 ↦((c1 ` s0)` c2))[~~>](limsup `(s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c7)↦((c5 ` s1)` c2))), (s0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c7)↦((c1 ` s0)` c2))[~~>](limsup `(s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c7)↦((c5 ` s1)` c2))))

  climeqmpt(s0, c0, ((c1 ` s0)` c2), (limsup `(s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c7)↦((c5 ` s1)` c2))), (ℤ≥ ` c7), universe, universe, c7, (ℤ≥ ` c7), universe, w0)
  a1i(w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  fvexi(c0, cuz, c3)
  fvexd(cuz, c7, w0)
  syl(w0, c7 ∈ ℤ, c7 ∈ c0)
  eluzelz2(c7, c0, c3)
  eqid((ℤ≥ ` c7))
  syl(w0, (ℤ≥ ` c7)⊆ c0, c7 ∈ c0)

blocks.name: smflimsuplem8
blocks.content: The superior limit of a sequence of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (d) of [Fremlin1] p. 39 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: smflimsup
blocks.content: The superior limit of a sequence of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (d) of [Fremlin1] p. 39 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: smflimsupmpt
blocks.content: The superior limit of a sequence of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (d) of [Fremlin1] p. 39 . ` A ` can contain ` m ` as a free variable, in other words it can be thought of as an indexed collection ` A ( m ) ` . ` B ` can be thought of as a collection with two indices ` B ( m , x ) ` . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm smflimsupmpt(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(csmblfn, c1)))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wnf(s1, w0)
  -| wnf(s2, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, csalg))
  -| wi(w3a(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c3), wcel(cv(s1), c4)), wcel(c5, c6))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c3)), wcel(cmpt(s1, c4, c5), cfv(csmblfn, c1)))
  -| wceq(c7, crab(s1, ciun(s2, c3, ciin(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(s2)), c4)), wcel(cfv(clsp, cmpt(s0, c3, c5)), cr)))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s1, c7, cfv(clsp, cmpt(s0, c3, c5))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c4)

blocks.name: smfliminflem
blocks.content: The inferior limit of a countable set of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (e) of [Fremlin1] p. 39 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 2-Jan-2022.)

blocks.name: smfliminf
blocks.content: The inferior limit of a countable set of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (e) of [Fremlin1] p. 39 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 2-Jan-2022.)

blocks.name: smfliminfmpt
blocks.content: The inferior limit of a countable set of sigma-measurable functions is sigma-measurable. Proposition 121F (e) of [Fremlin1] p. 39 . ` A ` can contain ` m ` as a free variable, in other words it can be thought of as an indexed collection ` A ( m ) ` . ` B ` can be thought of as a collection with two indices ` B ( m , x ) ` . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 2-Jan-2022.)
